user.biography: Craftsmanship without compromise. Pleasure beyond perfection. You must be of legal drinking/buying age to follow us. Please enjoy Krug responsibly.

node.text:
Onion and spice.

With his Lamb Tripe, Braised Madras Onions recipe, Chef @prateeksadhu brings a taste of home to Krug x Onion. “In Kashmir where I grew up, we have some of the best sheep in the area and I wanted to make something from my mother’s kitchen. The onions give the lamb a delightful sweetness and the subtle use of spice is just enough to accentuate the palate of Krug Rosé.”

#krugchampagne #krugxonion

node.text:
“I thought about a recipe that would be eco-friendly by choosing local ingredients to salvage from what might otherwise be discarded from your refrigerator or pantry: dry bread, pieces of cheese and onion. The ingredients are simple, but with a great Champagne, reconcile the most elegant of paradoxes. This pairing with Krug Rosé 23ème Édition is ideal for the intensity expressed in the Champagne through the Pinot Noir and Meunier, but, most of all, for the mineral richness and savoury notes that contrast with the sweetness of the onion.” @cicciosultano1 

#krugxonion #krugchampagne

node.text:
Chef Simon Davies was one of 11 Chefs who embarked on a culinary journey of discovery to India with Cellar Master Julie Cavil. 

He says of his Krug x Onion pairing: “I wanted to pay homage to India and use ingredients and flavours local to the area. It was important that onion shine in this dish and play off of the Champagne in a unique way.”

@simon.a.davies 

#krugxchampagne #krugxonion

#krugxonion #krugchampagne

node.text:
[Sound ON!]

From Tokyo to Chicago, Mumbai or London, 11 highly talented Chefs joined Krug Cellar Master Julie Cavil on a voyage to India’s culinary backbone, unleashing their imagination and creating unique onion-inspired recipes to pair with a glass of Krug. Over a three-day immersion, they experience first-hand how the Rajasthani interact with the onion, discovering inspiring new recipes and farming techniques while building friendships along the way. In 2021, become acquainted with @simon.a.davies , @chefangusmcintosh , @tristinfarmer , @uweo , @cheftheoclench , @cicciosultano1 , @prateeksadhu , @hiroyukkanda , @heiko_nieder , @der_reiser, @sushijin.kimura, and get a peelin’ for their unique styles. 

#krugxonion #krugchampagne

node.text:
Chef @guillaumegalliot and sommelier @victorpetiot of Krug Ambassade Caprice at the @fshongkong in Hong Kong S.A.R., China take on the Krug Cuisine Challenge.

This recipe is a new interpretation of Chef Galliot signature Cocoa Pigeon, with the addition of a mole sauce made from Piquillo peppers and strawberries.

Discover how the pigeon meat, pepper spice and strawberry sweetness are accentuated by a glass of Krug Rosé 23ème Édition.

#KrugChampagne #WorldofCraft #FoodPairing

node.text:
Chef @helenedarroze from @marsanparhelenedarroze reveals an elegantly simple way to prepare a fresh sea scallop in its shell with a hazelnut parsley butter to bring out the freshness of Krug Grande Cuvée 168ème Édition.

Taste this recipe with her and Olivier Krug @krugoli on December 16 by joining their live Zoom session. Registration link in bio.

#KrugChampagne #HeleneDarroze #WorldOfCraft #Champagne

node.title: From the kitchen of Chef Hélène Darroze in Paris

node.text:
Krug Ambassade Chef @pavelbycek from @theeaterybistro takes terroir cooking to another level with his Krug x Egg recipe of celeriac baked in soil served with Hollandaise sauce.

This method imparts an earthy flavour on the nutty root vegetable which, coupled with the creamy texture of the egg yolks in the sauce, brings out the structure and freshness of Krug Grande Cuvée.

“I like to cook with humble ingredients that are overlooked by most people,” he says. Chef Bycek’s dish for World of Craft is an wonderful illustration of how creativity can elevate the simplest ingredient to a culinary triumph.

#KrugChampagne #WorldofCraft #FoodPairing

node.text:
For his Krug Cuisine Challenge, Chef @robinzavou67 looks to the forest as he presents a Chawanmushi with shiitake and truffle, in honour of Krug's 2017 single ingredient. 

“The secret, if you can call it that, is simply to respect the ingredient. Every mushroom has a different taste, flavour and texture.”

#KrugChampagne #WorldofCraft #FoodPairing

node.title: Welcome to the kitchen of Krug Ambassade Chef @robinzavou67 in Hong Kong

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Krug Champagne on July 19, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Onions from the Cevennes in Condiment Servings Preparation time 20 Cooking time 10min'.

node.text:
A feast for the eyes and the palate.

Chef @yblinc of the @ritzcarltonbahrain makes an exquisite splash with Brittany lobster, colourful vegetables and a mango emulsion in his Onion from the Cevennes in Condiment recipe for Krug x Onion. See how the blend of textures and flavours enhances the many facets of Krug Grande Cuvée 168ème Édition.

#krugchampagne #krugxonion

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Krug Champagne on July 19, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Onions from the Cevennes in Condiment Servings Preparation time 20 Cooking time 10min'.
Photo by Krug Champagne on July 19, 2021. May be an image of food and indoor.

Photo by Krug Champagne on July 19, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'INGREDIENTS ONION CONDIMENT •1kg Cevenne onions •11 Bouillion of the onion peel Cream 35% •200g Butter •Salt •Sarawak white pepper YANN BERNARD LEJARD MANGO EMULSION •500g Mango ·150ml Krug Champagne ·50g Sugar •50ml Rasberry vinegar .Turmeric, cardamom, star anise Clove garlic confit Olive oil .Zest and juice of limes'.

Photo by Krug Champagne on July 19, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'INGREDIENTS YANN BERNARD LEJARD LOBSTER AND VEGETABLES 10 Brittany lobster 5 Thai eggplant candied in olive oil •Local lettuce leaves 5 Purple carrots Yellow beetroot •Pomelos Cherry tomato Purple cauliflower'.

Photo by Krug Champagne on July 19, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'INSTRUCTIONS ONION CONDIMENT .Cook the chopped onions slowly in with fresh butter. pot YANN BERNARD LEJARD 2. Add the bouillon and continue to cook until liquid is totally reduced. 3. Season, blend, cool and reserve. MANGO EMULSION 1. Caramelize the sugar and add the vinegar. 2. Add the cut mango and spice mix, cook for minute then pour the Krug Champagne, let it reduce gently for 10 minutes. 3. Add the confit garlic clove in high-speed food processor with the lime zest and juice, strain with a superbag and reserve.'.

Photo by Krug Champagne on July 19, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'INSTRUCTIONS LOBSTER AND VEGETABLES 1. Cook the lobster in boiling water for 5 minutes then add the claw and cook for 2 more minutes, put on ice, break and reserve. ANA BERNARD BERNARD LEJARD 2. Blanch all the vegetebles in salted boiling water. Put on ice, drain, dry and reserve. PLATING 1. Splatter the mango sauce on the plate, place a quenelle of the onion condiment in the center, arrange all the vegetables and lobster on the plate. 2. Finish with a few drops of olive oil from Provence, fleur de sel from Camargue.'.
Photo by Krug Champagne on July 19, 2021. May be an image of indoor.
Photo by Krug Champagne on July 17, 2021.

node.text:
The onion in all its glory. One of the most versatile ingredients used in cuisines around the world, it is a fitting match for Krug Grande Cuvée 169ème Édition, the most generous expression of Champagne, crafted around the harvest of 2013. With a unique fullness of flavours and aromas, it is a blend of 146 wines from 11 different years, the youngest of which is from 2013, while the oldest dates back to 2000.

#krugchampagne #krugxonion

node.text:
Chef @mario_affinita of the @don_geppi_restaurant at Italy’s Majestic Palace Hotel in Sant'Agnello brings refinement to a reinterpreted classic. Discover his Onion Risotto with Truffle Parmesan in a recipe that mixes three classic flavour elements, all of which beautifully accentuate the generosity of Krug Grande Cuvée.

#krugchampagne #krugxonion

node.text:
Onion and spice.

With his Lamb Tripe, Braised Madras Onions recipe, Chef @prateeksadhu brings a taste of home to Krug x Onion. “In Kashmir where I grew up, we have some of the best sheep in the area and I wanted to make something from my mother’s kitchen. The onions give the lamb a delightful sweetness and the subtle use of spice is just enough to accentuate the palate of Krug Rosé.”

#krugchampagne #krugxonion

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Krug Champagne on July 12, 2021. May be an image of 1 person, standing and food.

node.text:
So fresh you can taste it.

Chef @prateeksadhu ’s @masquerestaurant, a zero-waste establishment, is the first Krug Ambassade in India. Last year, he joined 11 Krug Ambassade Chefs and Cellar Master Julie Cavil.

 “As children around my aunt’s farm, we used to pluck and cook fresh vegetables straight away, essentially eating within an hour of harvesting. This is why at Masque we also have a farm; I believe the fresher the ingredients are, the tastier the dish will be.” 

#krugchampagne #krugxonion

node.text:
The right temperature. The House recommends serving Krug Champagnes between 9°C and 12°C, as colder temperatures limit their expression. Did you know that this is the temperature naturally achieved in Krug’s chalk cellars?

#krugchampagne

node.text:
The Krug Rosé glass. Graceful, ultra-light and born from a mouth-blown design, it is the right instrument to play Krug Rosé’s unexpected and joyful music.
 
Alternatively, Krug can be enjoyed in a white wine glass, but never in flutes, as they mask the Champagne’s flavours and aromas.

#krugchampagne

node.text:
Gateway to the sensations. Music and sound have the power to reveal a myriad of new dimensions to the sensorial experience that comes with every sip of Krug Champagnes. Discover Music Pairings for your bottle of Krug by entering its Krug iD online. 

#krugchampagne

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Krug Champagne on June 19, 2021. May be an image of bottle.

node.text:
One plot, one wine. Capturing individuality at the House of Krug means harvesting each plot separately and transforming its essence into a single wine that will express its distinctive, nuanced and unique features. Each plot’s wine is then kept individually until the final blending decision is made. “We look for the broadest, contrasted spectrum of these individualities, as we need precise, pure and diverse personalities to create a new Édition of Krug Grande Cuvée each year.” – Krug Cellar Master Julie Cavil

#krugchampagne

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Krug Champagne on June 17, 2021. May be an image of nature.

node.text:
Blossoms at Krug’s Clos du Mesnil. A pivotal moment in the growth cycle, each year these flowers bring the promise of the harvest to come. This tiny plot of Chardonnay has been surrounded by stone walls since 1698, giving the vineyard a unique microclimate and making it often one of the first to be harvested.

#krugchampagne

node.text:
Each year, to re-create the dream of the fifth generation of the Krug family of an unexpected, bold and elegant rosé Champagne, the House starts by identifying plots’ wines from the current and previous years that will together convey all possible types of fruit expression. Surprisingly, Krug Rosé best accompanies savoury dishes like game or fresh sardines.

#krugxonion #krugchampagne

node.text:
“I thought about a recipe that would be eco-friendly by choosing local ingredients to salvage from what might otherwise be discarded from your refrigerator or pantry: dry bread, pieces of cheese and onion. The ingredients are simple, but with a great Champagne, reconcile the most elegant of paradoxes. This pairing with Krug Rosé 23ème Édition is ideal for the intensity expressed in the Champagne through the Pinot Noir and Meunier, but, most of all, for the mineral richness and savoury notes that contrast with the sweetness of the onion.” @cicciosultano1 

#krugxonion #krugchampagne
